page.title: 19TRANSPORT
page.content: 14% said that it was too expensive and 4% had other reasons. We found these results rather interesting because we also went around all the classes in the school asking the children how many of their parents had one or more car. Every child in the school had a car at home. So it is fairly obvious to us that the people who use the local bus service are mostly elderly people who either do not own a car or are unable or unfit to drive. Our assumptiom seems quite true because having watched the bus stop near the school for one week, we found that 83% of the people who waited for a bus were old age pensioners.
